adventure_overview: Adult leaders supervising activities afloat must have completed Safety Afloat training within the previous two years. Cub Scout activities afloat are limited to council, district, pack, or den events on calm or gently flowing water that do not include float trips (expeditions). Safety Afloat standards apply to the use of canoes, kayaks, rowboats, rafts, floating tubes, sailboats, motorboats (including waterskiing), and other small craft (Stand Up Paddle Boards). Grip, shaft, throat, shoulder, blade, and tip are all parts of a paddle. In this Adventure, you’ll discover the world of paddle crafts. Canoes, kayaks, and stand-up paddleboards all rely on you as the source of power. There are places that you can get to only by paddle craft. You will also learn how to be safe when using a paddle craft, from learning about your equipment to proper ways to paddle your craft.

requirements.text: Before attempting requirements 6 and 7 for this Adventure, you must pass Scouting America swimmer test.

activities.name: Swimmers Test
activities.description: Cub Scouts swim for the Scouting America swimmer test.

requirements.text: Pick a paddle craft you’ll use to complete all requirements: canoe, kayak, or stand-up paddleboard.

activities.name: Picking Paddle Craft
activities.description: Cub Scouts pick from one of the paddle crafts to complete remaining requirements.

requirements.text: With your den or an adult, discuss the role of qualified adult supervision at a paddle craft activity.

activities.name: Qualified Supervision
activities.description: Cub Scouts identify the attributes of a qualified adult at a boating activity.

requirements.text: Explain the safety rules to follow when safely using a paddle craft.

activities.name: Paddling Safely Rule Game
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn the safety rules to follow when using a paddle craft.

requirements.text: Discover how to tell if a life jacket is the correct size and approved for your paddle craft activity. Demonstrate how to wear it.

activities.name: Life Jacket Education
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about life jackets.

requirements.text: Explore how your paddle craft responds as you move your paddle through the water from different places.
Have 30 minutes, or more, of canoe, kayak, or stand-up paddleboard paddle time.

activities.name: Paddling Around for Fun
activities.description: Cub Scouts enjoy 30 minutes of paddle craft activity.
